history.content:
Hey there! I highly recommend looking into Angellist for opportunities at startups: https://angel.co

I also recommend reaching out to startups that are part of SkyDeck! I interned at one last summer, and it was one of the best work experiences that I had. Everyone in my team was so approachable and friendly, and as a result, I learned so much: https://skydeck.berkeley.edu

It's never too late; don't give up. :)

children.subject: You could also try research during the summer at Berkeley. You might not get a pay as high as some EE/CS internships at companies, but you will certainly gain some valuable experience for next year.

Hey there, like student answer said, it is not too late! It hardly ever is. It definitely is possible to find spots now. I know friends who just secured their internships this month and towards the end of March. There are always companies/teams looking for help. If you haven't already been applying to spots on job posting websites like LinkedIn, keep doing that. If you haven't been getting interviews or calls back, consider having your resume spruced up and checked by people to see if it can be better and can get you a foot in the door.

history.content: Starting to feel very discouraged about myself for not landing an internship yet since recruiting season feels long over :( Is it common for companies to keep hiring interns at this time of year? If so, is there a better place to look for them than traditional job platforms?
history.subject: Still don't have summer internship; possible to find one last minute?
